intro: Leucanthemum vulgare, commonly known as oxeye daisy, is a flowering plant native to Europe, North Africa, and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its white petals surrounding a yellow central disk, forming a daisy-like appearance. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It has a fibrous root system and produces small, wind-pollinated flowers from late spring to early autumn. Oxeye daisy is often found in meadows, roadsides, and disturbed soils, and it is known for its medicinal and ornamental uses.
